description: From Middle English helen, from Old English hǣlan (“to heal, cure, save, greet, salute”), from Proto-West Germanic *hailijan, from Proto-Germanic *hailijaną (“to heal, make whole, save”), from Proto-Indo-European *koyl- (“safe, unharmed”).

entries.meaning: (role-playing games, countable) A spell or ability that restores hit points or removes a status ailment.
examples: Also, various interesting spells have been added—for instance, with the Orb spell, you can circle a character, firing offensive bolts or casting heals, and free up a mage-type to cast other spells or even melee.

verbs.description: heal (third-person singular simple present heals, present participle healing, simple past and past participle healed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make better from a disease, wound, etc.; to revive or cure.
examples: This bandage will help to heal your cut.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To become better or healthy again.
(transitive, figurative) To reconcile, as a breach or difference; to make whole; to free from guilt.

verbs.description: heal (third-person singular simple present heals, present participle healing, simple past and past participle healed)
